content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It offers a bit of challenge to solve it.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Can be solved fast, by just reading Input/Output & outline in Goal section.
Good for fast coding challenges.
Missing edge case: no test where both A and B are negative with op = * (e.g. -11 * -3 should give 3). Consider adding one pair for this combination.

General
* Please apply formatting as explained in the points below. The syntax can be found here: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement

Goal
* Please format +, -, * and / as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please change "quotient" to "keep only the integer part, truncation towards zero".

Input
* Please delete all -'s before "Line".

* Please format "Line 1", "Line 2" and "Line 3" in <<bold>>.

* Please format "A", "op" and "B" as [[variables]].

* Please format +, -, * and / as {{constants}}.

* Please remove all the quotation marks.

Output
* Please change "-" to "<<Line 1>>:".

Constraints
* Please delete all -'s (bullets) for all the constraints.

* Please format "A" and "B" as [[variables]].

* Please format 0 and * as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please delete the third constraint.

Cases
* Simple multiplication (division) (Test 3): Please remove the trailing newline from the output.

* Please rename the following cases in English:
  • Nombres négatifs (Test 5)
  • Division avec reste (Test 6)
  • Grand nombres (Test 7)

* Please add a new pair of cases where op is * and the fractional part of A / B is greater than 0.5 (such that a simple rounding will output the wrong answer).

* Please add a new pair of cases where op is *, A is positive, B is negative and the fractional part of the absolute value of A / B is *less* than 0.5.

* Please add a new pair of cases where op is *, A is negative, B is positive and the fractional part of the absolute value of A / B is greater than 0.5.

* Please add a new pair of cases where op is - and the expected output is between -100 and -999.

Thanks.
Thanks  a lot! All your comments have been taken into account. :)
Added a pair of test cases, thanks for feedback!

Would you please follow up the points below?

Input
* Please add "for the first operand" after "[[A]]".

* Please add "for the original operator" after "{{/}}".

* Please add "for the second operand" after "[[B]]"

Cases
* These cases are the same:
  • Validator 6
  • Another division (Test 8)

  Please revise Validator 6 so that the fractional part of the answer before truncation is less than 0.5, and the answer is greater than 3.

* Negative divisor (Test 9): Please revise the case so that the fractional part of the answer before truncation is less than 0.5, and the answer is smaller than -10.

* Validator 9: Same comment as Test 9 above. Ensure the answer is different.

Thanks.
